discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Bluetooth Hacking - Btlejacking
A Btlejacking attack is detrimental to Bluetooth low energy (BLE) devices. The attacker can sniff, jam, and take control of the data transmission between BLE devices by performing an MITM attack.
Btlejacking Using BtleJack
STEP 5: Now, start hijacking the connection：btlejack -f 0x9c68fd30 -t -m 0x1fffffffff (P.2351/2335)

Ans is A
see page 2351

A is Correct.

Btlejack is also able to hijack an existing connection, use the -t option to do so. Once hijacked, Btlejack will give you a prompt allowing you to interact with the hijacked device.

First, hijack an existing connection: $ btlejack -f 0x9c68fd30 -t -m 0x1fffffffff

BtleJack version 1.1

$ btlejack -f 0x9c68fd30 -t -m 0x1fffffffff

discussion.content:
From the authors github site:
Hijacking an existing BLE 5 connection
I did not manage to hijack a BLE 5 connection at this time, as this attack is time-sensitive. My BLE 5 devices use a latency of 0, thus allowing no delay and causing this attack to fail.

When I will get my hands on some legitimate BLE 5 devices, I will improve this.
https://github.com/virtualabs/btlejack

questions.question_text:
Clark, a professional hacker, attempted to perform a Btlejacking attack using an automated tool, Btlejack, and hardware tool, micro:bit. This attack allowed Clark to hijack, read, and export sensitive information shared between connected devices. To perform this attack, Clark executed various btlejack commands.
Which of the following commands was used by Clark to hijack the connections?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
clear log process

Correct.

Clearing Track:
An intelligent hacker always clears all evidence so that in the later point of time, no one will find any traces leading to him. This involves modifying/corrupting/deleting the values of Logs, modifying registry values and uninstalling all applications he used and deleting all folders he created
Correct

questions.question_text: Which among the following is the best example of the hacking concept called "clearing tracks"?

choices.B: During a cyberattack, a hacker injects a rootkit into a server.
choices.C: After a system is breached, a hacker creates a backdoor to allow re-entry into a system.
choices.A: An attacker gains access to a server through an exploitable vulnerability.
choices.D: During a cyberattack, a hacker corrupts the event logs on all machines.

Harris is attempting to identify the OS running on his target machine. He inspected the initial TTL in the IP header and the related TCP window size and obtained the following results:

TTL: 64 -

Window Size: 5840 -
What the OS running on the target machine?

discussion.content: TTL Windows 128 / TTL Linux 64

Selected Answer: C
Correct is C. Linux
There are 2 Ans in the Options... Both Linus and MAC has a TTL of 64

Selected Answer: C
How to Identify Target System OS
TTL 64, and Windows Size 5840 is Linux (Kernel2.4 and 2.6). (P.341/325)

C is Correct.

For Default TTL (Time To Live) Values of Different OS

https://subinsb.com/default-device-ttl-values/
Correct C: Linux Kernel

questions.question_text: Which type of attack attempts to overflow the content-addressable memory (CAM) table in an Ethernet switch?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
MAC Flooding
The size of the CAM table is fixed, and as it can store only a limited number of MAC addresses in it, an attacker may send numerous fake MAC address to the switch.
Attackers use the MAC flooding technique to force a switch to act as a hub so that they can easily sniff the traffic. (P.1119/1103)

D is Correct.

MAC address flooding attack (CAM table flooding attack) is a type of network attack where an attacker connected to a switch port floods the switch interface with very large number of Ethernet frames with different fake source MAC address.
Correct D (MAC Flooding or ARP Flooding)

questions.question_text: Which Nmap switch helps evade IDS or firewalls?

discussion.content:
-D <decoy1,decoy2[,ME],...>: Cloak a scan with decoys
-n/-R: Never do DNS resolution/Always resolve [default: sometimes]
-o (whatever) defines the Output method
 -T<0-5>: Set timing template (higher is faster)

So, -T0 would make the scans slower, and help evade.

comments.content:
no
incorrect
it's Decoy, check study book, evasion topic

-T only stands for timing. The number you add (-T0 - -T5) is what now determines if it can evade IDS (-T0 being the best). So this cannot be the answer since the option did not specifically state *-T0*

However, -D (decoy Scan) is solely meant for IDS evasion, so this is a better option. 

I hope this helps.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct option is A.
Flag -D fragments packets
should be -D

Which makes option D also right. that is flags -/oN/-oX/-G true

Selected Answer: A
The only one that fits is Decoy https://www.hackingloops.com/nmap-scanning-tutorial-firewall-and-ids-evasion/

Selected Answer: A
IDS/Firewall Evasion Techniques - IP Address Decoy
IP address decoy technique refers to generating or manually specifying the IP addresses of decoys in order to evade an IDS or firewall.
#Nmap -D RND:10 <target IP address> (P.359/343)

Selected Answer: D
The answer is A.
check this : https://nmap.org/book/man-bypass-firewalls-ids.html

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A. The -D stands for decoy scan

Selected Answer: A
From nmap site: https://nmap.org/book/man-briefoptions.html

FIREWALL/IDS EVASION AND SPOOFING:
 -f; --mtu <val>: fragment packets (optionally w/given MTU)
 -D <decoy1,decoy2[,ME],...>: Cloak a scan with decoys

Selected Answer: A
Correct A
 -D <señuelo1 [,señuelo2][,ME],...> (Esconde un sondeo con señuelos)

Realiza un sondeo con señuelos. Esto hace creer que el/los equipo/s que utilice como señuelos están también haciendo un sondeo de la red. De esta manera sus IDS pueden llegar a informar de que se están realizando de 5 a 10 sondeos de puertos desde distintas direcciones IP, pero no sabrán qué dirección IP está realizando el análisis y cuáles son señuelos inocentes. Aunque esta técnica puede vencerse mediante el seguimiento del camino de los encaminadores, descarte de respuesta («response-dropping», N. del T.), y otros mecanismos activos, generalmente es una técnica efectiva para esconder su dirección IP.

Check Nmap's official page here:https://nmap.org/book/man-bypass-firewalls-ids.html
The answer, based on the available options here, would be -D (Decoy)

Selected Answer: A
Decoy scan is used to evade ids - it is the most correct option of all.

Selected Answer: A
-D is IP address Decoy Scan to generate or manually specify IP addresses of the decoys to evade IDS/firewalls.

Selected Answer: C
According to "NMAP network scanning" by Gordon "Fyodor" Lyon re Timing Templates (-T) page 142: "The first two (i.e. paranoid and sneaky) are for IDS evasion."
D Decoy
